register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the hardware supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds 1 status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_60M_P2_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_60M_P1_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the HSIC_P2_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the HSIC_P1_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the UTMI_ROOT_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the TLL_CH0_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the HSIC_P2_480M_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the HSIC_P1_480M_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_HSMMC2_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_HSMMC1_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_HSI_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_DPLL_HS_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_DPLL_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_48MC_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the INIT_48M_FCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4_INIT_ICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3_INIT_ICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3INIT clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain dependencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4WKUP clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4SEC clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4PER clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4CFG clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards MEMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards ABE clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards IVAHD clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

register.description: This register manages the MMC1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 64MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
96MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the MMC2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 64MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
96MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the HSI clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the functional clock source.

bitenum.description: HSI_FCLK is divide by 1 of 192-MHz clock, to be used for OPP100
HSI_FCLK is divide by 2 of 192-MHz clock, to be used for OPP50
HSI_FCLK is divide by 4 of 192-MHz clock

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.Read 0x: Reserved .

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).
Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain

register.description: This register manages the USB_HOST_HS clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Port2 on USB Host

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an I/O pad.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Por1 on USB Host

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an I/O pad.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: FUNC48MCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC480M_P2_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC480M_P1_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC60M_P2_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC60M_P1_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P3_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P2_CLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P2 is 0

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P1_CLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P1 is 0

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: SAR mode control for the module. Shall not be modify except if module is disabled.

bitenum.description: SAR mode is disabled
SAR mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the USB_OTG_HS clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the 60MHz functional clock.

bitenum.description: The 60MHz clock is sourced from on die UTMI PHY
The 60MHz clock is sourced from the external ULPI PHY

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB_OTG optional clock control: XCLK (60MHz clock)

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the USB_TLL clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: USB_CH1_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: USB_CH0_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: SAR mode control for the module. Shall not be modify except if module is disabled.

bitenum.description: SAR mode is disabled
SAR mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).
